What is the market situation

The Digital Decade with EUR 165 billion in EU funding is expected to directly contribute to completing Digital Decade targets by 2030
Priority line is to build up a resilient digital infrastructure.

The Digital Decade Decision sets several targets with regard to digital infrastructures.

Edge computing

For our project it is most relevant, the EU should deploy at least 10 000 climate-neutral, highly secure edge nodes.

Target: edge nodes

The development of edge nodes will represent a paradigm change for data storage and processing, moving to a much more decentralized model, reducing the volume of data that needs to be transmitted over the network, along with improving cloud computing's overall performance.

Global spending on edge computing is steadily on the rise: it has reached EUR 190 billion in 2023, an increase of 13.1% over 2022, and is expected to reach nearly EUR 289 billion in 2026. By 2025, edge computing will complement cloud computing for nearly every enterprise.

The digitalisation of businesses is one of the most crucial current elements for the success and growth of the economy in a highly volatile environment

The Digital Decade Decision sets three targets with regard to the digital transformation of businesses.

First, at least 75% of EU enterprises shall have taken up cloud computing services, big data, and/or AI.

Second, more than 90% of EU SMEs shall have reached at least a basic level of digital intensity.

Third, the EU facilitates the growth of its innovative scale-ups and improves their access to finance, leading to at least doubling the number of unicorns.

These are the main drivers behind a huge investment activity in the industry

These are the main drivers behind a huge investment activity in the industry to be propelled by the EU as part of the EU Digital Decade strategy.

This It creates a raft of opportunities for edge cloud infrastructure and flexible datacentre development close to its users.

The combination of  a huge uptick in power consumption in all hyperscale DC locations in Amsterdam, Paris, Frankfurt, Dublin, Milan with a potential growth demand for additional computing power additions, there is not enough space in the grid to cater to all these requirements. There is a wide expectation of a 6 fold rise in the next decade.

Therefore, our strategy to be close to the power generation while a using direct connection line to generation with a limited utilization of the power grid saves costs and enables higher operational flexibility.

Mid-term Vision based on the above mentioned macro assumptions:

Revolutionize the data center industry by building a network of interconnected, efficient, and strategically located small—to—medium-sized data centers (DCs) offering superior service and flexibility. (This is based on extensive experience and cost related to TIER 4 and big datacenters, that we do believe will become much less frequent and interesting.)

Leveraging EU support, we aim to offer a robust alternative to the monopolistic hold of industry giants, with competitive advantages in efficiency, security, and regulatory compliance,

Growth Trajectory and Market Valuation:
  • The global data center market is experiencing a significant surge, with a valuation of US$ 30.41 billion in 2024. This figure is anticipated to reach US$ 117.24 billion by 2034, marking a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of approximately 14.40%.
  • This expansion is propelled by technological advancements and an escalating need for data processing and storage across various sectors, bolstered by the large-scale adoption of cloud computing and digital services
Energy Efficiency and Sustainability:

In efforts to minimize energy waste and enhance operational efficiency and sustainability, the industry is advancing towards lower Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) values and is expected to grow fastest, with an average annual growth rate of over 13%.

Technological Innovations and Reliability:

The rapid adoption of virtualization and cloud computing technologies is reshaping the industry by enabling hardware resource optimization and cost efficiencies, thus significantly contributing to the markets expansion.

The Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) segment is set for noteworthy growth at a CAGR of over 14%, highlighting the essential need for sustainable power protection to ensure uninterrupted operations and prevent data loss.

Strategic Implications for Investors:

The data center markets robust growth presents lucrative opportunities for investors.

Sustainable practices and technological advancements are key drivers shaping the future of data storage and processing, positioning data centers as a pivotal component of the global digital infrastructure

Investors should consider the strategic importance of data centers in the digital economy, with their critical role in processing and storing vast amounts of data, and the ongoing efforts to enhance efficiency and reliabilit*

Coupled with its emphasis on energy efficiency and adoption of cutting-edge technologies

This markets promising outlook underscores its importance as an investment opportunity, particularly for those looking to capitalize on the digital eras expansive growth and the ongoing shift towards sustainable and efficient data processing solutions

Growing Demand:

With digital transformation accelerating globally, the demand for data processing and storage is at an all-time high.

Amazon.com Inc. plans to invest around $150 billion in data centers over the next 15 years to meet the surging demand for AI applications and digital services. This aggressive expansion aims to maintain Amazons lead in the cloud services market. The investment will focus on expanding current facilities and establishing new ones in various global locations, including Mississippi, Saudi Arabia, and Malaysia.

Traditional air cooling methods are becoming less effective, prompting a shift towards liquid cooling solutions. This transition is driven by the need for more efficient, sustainable, and reliable cooling methods, especially for high-density computing hardware like GPUs. The shift towards liquid cooling, despite historical reservations about water near electronics, promises lower power consumption and reduced water usage compared to air cooling. (We have a different cooling solution)

The Forbes article titled "Heres Why Data Center Cooling Is The Hottest Innovation In The Sector" highlights the critical challenge of cooling in data centers, driven by the massive demand from AI, machine learning, and supercomputing. As the CEO of Aligned Data Centers, Andrew Schaap, points out, data centers are essential to the digital world, powering everything from scientific research to everyday appliances like smart fridges. However, they also generate significant heat.

The traditional cooling methods, mostly air-based, are becoming less effective and sustainable, given the bulky infrastructure and high energy and water usage. This has led to an urgent need for more efficient cooling solutions, especially as data center power consumption in the U.S. is projected to double between 2022 and 2030

EU Support in data economy:

The European Union actively supports small to midsize data center projects, which foster local tech independence and improve critical infrastructure.

European Data Strategy

The European Data Strategy intends to make the EU a leader in a data-driven society by creating a single market, allowing data to flow freely across the EU, benefiting businesses, researchers, and public administrations.

With the European Data Act, the strategy aims to make more data available, addressing legal, economic, and technical issues leading to data underutilization, and is expected to create €270 billion of additional GDP for EU Member States by 2028.

Investing in IoT

The European Unions Digital Decade policy program targets digital transformation with Cloud, edge, and IoT investments deemed necessary for European industries, particularly SMEs, to enhance technological sovereignty and support the data economy.

The EU funds projects to strengthen the European supply and value chains in the cloud-to-edge-to-IoT continuum, integrating computing, connectivity, IoT, AI, and cybersecurity.

How INDATNET is changing the game?

A shift towards efficiency and decentralization is not just anticipated its already happening. Our extensive market research underlines a clear trend: the future of datacenters lies in their ability to be both more effective and more sustainable. This presents a golden opportunity for forward-thinking investors.

Why Now is the Opportune Moment

The datacenter sector is at a pivotal juncture, with demands for efficiency and sustainability driving significant change. Were positioned at the forefront of this transition, offering a solution that addresses these needs head-on. Our innovation doesnt just promise; it delivers. With a focus on achieving a low Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE), our data centers stand out for their reduced operational costs and substantial alignment with global sustainability objectives.

The Competitive Edge: Efficiency and Sustainability

PUE, a critical measure of a datacenters efficiency, is a cornerstone of our offering. A lower PUE signifies a more efficient datacenter, leading to lower operational costs and a lesser environmental impact. Our data centers achieve an unparalleled PUE of 1.1, setting a new benchmark in the industry. To put this into perspective, the best PUEs globally hover around 1.1 to 1.2, with anything below 1.5 considered highly efficient. This isnt a concept in development its a reality weve already achieved. Our solution not only meets but exceeds the future trends of datacenter efficiency.

What is PUE - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_usage_effectiveness

Global Data Center Network Initiative - The Plan

  • We are revolutionizing the data center industry by establishing a global network of scalable and interconnected small—to medium-sized data centers from 150 kW to 3-5 MW.

  • This decentralized approach promises enhanced security, sustainability, and cost efficiency, challenging the dominance of large-scale operators.

  • We ensure compliance and optimize operational costs by prioritizing locations that provide supportive regulatory frameworks and available subsidies.

    Move towards a sales platform model as computing power becomes commoditized, emphasizing customer service and competitive pricing.

  • 05 Operational Launch & Sales Support:

    Begin operations with robust sales and marketing support, leveraging the network for reliability and flexibility.

  • 06 Growth & Expansion:

    Continuous assessment and expansion plans will ensure the network’s relevance and competitiveness, focusing on technological advancements and market trends.

Who is the INDATNET group?
Since 2016, our team has been designing and operating state-of-the-art data centers, and our expertise and innovative approach provide a competitive edge in several key areas:
  • Turnkey Large-Scale Data Centers

    We have a proven track record of delivering comprehensive solutions for building and retrofitting large-scale data centers, ensuring efficiency, reliability, and scalability.

  • Proprietary Technology and Software

    Our in-house developed technology and monitoring systems streamline operations and maintenance, setting new industry standards for operational excellence.

  • Cost-Effective Hardware Solutions

    Our proprietary server designs deliver twice the performance of conventional solutions offered by industry giants such as IBM and DELL at half the cost, providing a significant competitive advantage and higher profit margins.

  • Revolutionary Cooling Design

    Our innovative cooling technology not only significantly reduces operational expenses (with a PUE of around 1.1, far surpassing the global norm of 1.35) but also underscores our commitment to sustainability. This translates to operational costs that are up to three times lower than our competitors'.

  • Critical Infrastructure Expertise

    Acknowledging the critical nature of data centers, we have successfully completed projects from Tier 1 to Tier 3, demonstrating our capability to meet diverse infrastructure needs.

  • Diverse Revenue Streams

    Our specialization spans high-demand sectors such as AI, machine learning, blockchain, cryptocurrency, enterprise cloud services, and data backup, ensuring multiple revenue generation channels compliant with NIS2 standards.

Showcasing Outstanding Efficiency & High Potential Returns of Kladno DC
  • Premier Efficiency

    Boasting a Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) of around 1.1, our Kladno Data Center sets a new standard in operational efficiency, significantly surpassing the industry norm. This translates to lower operating costs and a reduced environmental footprint, positioning our facility as a benchmark in sustainable data center operations.

  • Specifications

    • Installed Power: 3.6MW, supporting high-density computing needs.

    • Facility Size: 1,175 m², optimally designed for performance and scalability.

    • Rack Capacity: 165 racks, each with a 20kW load, accommodating intense compute demands.

    • Diverse Infrastructure: Three halls, including two Tier II and one Tier III, provide flexibility and resilience. The infrastructure is prepared for Tier III upgrades across additional halls, ensuring future-proof scalability.

  • Valuation & Market Positioning

    With industry asset deals for facilities over 1 MW ranging between EUR 7-16 million/MW, our data center represents a lucrative investment opportunity:

    • Tier III Hall Valuation: 0.26 MW at EUR 9.9 million/MW, totaling EUR 2.574 million.

    • Tier II Halls Valuation: 3.16 MW at EUR 8.9 million/MW, amounting to EUR 28.124 million.

  • Pictures from project Kladno:
